did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS) Collection, c. 1900-2001
did.abstract: The collection contains material collected by the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS). Materials include pamphlets, scrapbooks, photographs, negatives, slides, video tapes, invitations, and programs from department, college, and university events.

origination.label: Creator

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS) Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS), Ms2013-010, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS) Collection was donated to Special Collections in July 2011. Future accruals are expected.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS) Collection was completed in April 2013.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Agriculture classes have been offered at Virginia Tech since its first days as a university in the 1872. When the first major administrative divisions of the university emerged just after the turn of the century, the Department of Agriculture was among them, with the first dean being appointed in 1903. In 1921, division became known as the School of Agriculture; in 1964, the College of Agriculture; and in 1971, the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS). Today, it includes more than a dozen academic departments. CALS remains closely connected to the Virginia Agricultural Experience Station (established in 1886) and the Virginia Cooperative Extension, established in 1914.
For information about the history of the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences visit the college website at http://www.cals.vt.edu/about/history/index.html.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains material collected by the Department of Agriculture in the College of Agriculture and Life Sciences (CALS). Materials include pamphlets, scrapbooks, photographs, negatives, slides, video tapes, invitations, and programs from department, college, and university events. An oversize framed picture from this collection, "Serious Considerations," is currently located in Special Collections art collection.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The following publications were cataloged for Special Collections Rare Book Collection:

Ecological Effects of Pest Resistance Genes in Manage Ecosystems, 1999 Virginia's Agricultural Experiment Station: 100 Years of Research, 1986 New Crops, New Uses, New Markets, 1992 The Virginia Horse Industry Directory Buyer's Guide, 2004 Agriculture in the Twenty-First Century, 1983 The New Power of Regions: A Policy Focus for Rural America, 2002 History of Bumpers College: Evolution of Education in the Agricultural, Food, and Life Sciences in Arkansas
